item.description:
Please consider joining Rhode Island Oath Keepers as we show our great appreciation for the sacrifices made to secure our freedoms this Memorial Day May 27.

The Rhode Island Oath Keepers outreach float will be part of the Richmond/Carolina Memorial Day parade again this year.  We are looking for a few veterans to ride in a place of honor on the float. (Please contact me ASAP)

We will be mustering at 08:00  (8 a.m. sharp) at the American Legion " Downey-Weaver Post 34" - 22 Whipple Dr., Charlestown, RI, 02813

These parades have turned out to be very rewarding experiences and great outreach opportunities.

The parade will start at the Richmond/Carolina fire Department, 208 Richmond Townhouse Rd, Carolina, RI 02812.  It will proceed south on Route 112 for about a mile and half and consist of two short Memorial Day ceremonies with a 21 gun salute.  (Refreshments to be served afterwards at the American Legion Post)

Bring lots of Flags, Friends and Family

Some are asking about a dress code, there is no "absolute" dress code but respectful attire is suggested.  Oath Keeper hats and shirts or just a white shirt) with black pants would be fine. American military uniforms from colonial to present day would be great.

(National Oath Keepers T-shirts and the new Rhode Island Oath Keepers T-shirts will be available at the start.)

Stand up and Sign up Now!

Please leave enthusiastic RSVP's, Great testimonials from previous parades or excuses below.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Rhode Island Oath Keepers Parade Float...
item.name: Rhode Island Oath Keepers at Memorial Day parade
